reviewText: We love that you can get 4 movies for a small price, and even get to see movies we had never seen before! Bought it for one, and have watched all four and like them all! Check out other movies from this seller, and I think you will be happy as well!

These movies are great romantic comedies, would for sure recommend them.
The Perfect Man is about a teenager named Holly Hamilton (Hilary Duff)who is tired of moving every time her single mom Jean (Heather Locklear) is through with her latest mistake of a man. To prevent her mother from making another bad decision, Holly has an idea: create a secret admirer who is the perfect man. But things spin out of control and Holly has to improvise.
Head over Heels is about a woman, Amanda Pierce (Monica Potter) living in New York City who works at Metropolitan Museum of Art restoring paintings. Early in the film, she moves in with four supermodels and falls for a man living in an apartment that they can see across the street. After the models try to help Amanda get the man, they find out he might not be what he appears to be.
Wimledon is about a washed-up tennis pro named Peter Colt and an up-and-coming tennis star named Lizzie Bradbury  during the Wimbledon Championships who fall in love.
The story of us is about Ben and Katie Jordan who are a married couple that go through hard times in fifteen years of marriage.
The one movie I wanted, "Matchmaker", was cheaper in this four pack than by itself.
Good combination of movies......although I just bought it for "Heart and Souls"

The dvd set only came with 1 out of the 2 DVDs (as per product description there is supposed to be multiple). I feel like I have been ripped off. I wouldnt waste your time purchasing this item because it does not come as stated.

Very good combo of movies. It takes a minute to figure out how to get to the other movies. You have to enter the DVD menu, where you might find deleted scenes and DVD extras. Not hard, but not completely intuitive. Maybe it's just the way my DVD player works, but it didn't automatically default to that menu. Either way, great chick flick combo DVD for a very good price.
already had this and it got broke, just love the movies

It wasn't funny, there storyline was just ridiculous. It bored me honestly.  Prime was idk, Iiked it a little but the ending made me dislike it. There wasn't really an ending. I found this little movie bundle for a little over $5 and am very happy with it.  It comes with four movies: About A Boy, Prime, The Wedding Date, and Intolerable Cruelty.  It comes as a two DVD set (two movies per DVD) with separate holders for each.  The case does not have details for each movie but here is a small description for each:

About A Boy (2002) - A cynical, immature young man is taught how to act like a grown-up by a little boy.
Prime (2005) - A career driven professional from Manhattan is wooed by a young painter, who also happens to be the son of her psychoanalyst.
The Wedding Date (2005) - Single-girl anxiety causes Kat Ellis (Messing) to hire a male escort (Mulroney) to pose as her boyfriend at her sister's wedding. Her plan, an attempt to dupe her ex-fianc, who dumped her a couple years prior, proves to be her undoing.
Intolerable Cruelty (2003) - A beautiful gold digger matches wits with a shrewd Beverly Hills divorce lawyer who is increasingly attracted to her.

Overall, it's not a bad set for what you pay.  Thanks Amazon.
My Mom loves this type of movie so this was a perfect gift. She really enjoyed it and having 4 in one made it easier for her.

What you see is NOT what you get. When you order the above DVD, "4 MOVIE ROMANTIC COMEDY COLLECTION"  you get a totally different 4 movie collection, I did NOT order.  The perfect Man; Head over Heels;  Wimbledon;  Story of us...

I ordered "4 MOVIE ROMANTIC COMEDY COLLECTION":  Kissing a Fool;  Heart and Souls;  Matchmaker;  Playing For Keeps. as pictured on the advertisement.  BUT I got a set totally different set. I ordered this set mainly for "HEART AND SOULS; IT WAS NOT WHAT I GOT. . THIS IS AMAZON'S LISTING MISTAKE, NOT THE SELLERS FAULT.

Bought this because I simply adore the film "The Matchmaker" and since it was available with "Heart and Souls", I saw this 4-pack as a bonus to get them together. The other films were less than enjoyable . . . though I am glad I didn't pay for them individually. I thought there might be some sort of connection between the four films, you know, actors or theme or anything. But there was no link at all. Had just these two films been together, this would be a 5-star pack. But because the other two bring it way down, I had to settle for a 4.

Heart and Souls is a lovely story about finishing one's work on earth by invading the life of a newborn. Four disparate characters in a bus accident end up becoming a part of Robert Downey's life, first as "imaginary" childhood friends. They can never go too far away from him and must put up with his unlovely personality as he gets older. Until the time comes for the four to go to Heaven and they need Downey to interact with those they left behind. Good really does come from within.

The Matchmaker is a tale of a woman who must carry out the odd request of her employer to find his Irish heritage. Unfortunately, she ends up in the middle of a matchmaking festival in Ireland. The result is predictable but there are some great characters along the way, including a couple of the old matchmakers themselves. There really is a matchmaker festival in Ireland, in a little village called Lisdoonvarna, which is quite close to the Cliffs of Moher that overlook the west coast of Ireland. This is not where the film takes place but the event is real and I hope to go myself one day!

This is a great gift for the holiday season. It has just the right amount of young family appeal, but not so much that young adults can't find it enjoyable. A++ in my book. -Joy Johnson http://www.amazon.com/-/e/B00935YTUK

Heart and Souls is wonderful -- the reason I purchased this item in the first place. The Matchmaker is a bit contrived, but still enjoyable. Kissing a Fool is watchable. Playing for Keeps was a waste of the DVD it was burned on. Individual ratings of 5, 3, 2, and 0. The average was rounded up because I like Heart and Souls so much. Fortunately I did not have any hopes for the other movies, so I was not too disappointed!
They are great light hearted movies, no drama just romantic comedy. I'm glad I bought them and I would recommend these to a friend.

First, the idea of putting four pictures in one package like this has a lot of merit. It is a great way to add to your library without spending a lot of dollars.

My wife and I were disappointed in all the films in this collection and as such, would have rated them somewhere between one and two stars for each. They simply did not engage our interest, especially consider the quality of the performers.
